page.title: 16PAST AND PRESENT, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: A recently retired villager well remembers a self sufficient village in the{1930s,}when Hockliffe had its own {butcher, slaughterer, bakers, tailor and{blacksmith.}Today it has just a {grocers}and a{Post Office}including a {newsagents.} Prices too have changed, bread was{1p}a loaf and now its{44p. Houses stand on the old shop sites. Until{1931}children were able to play in the street{(A5)}then the road was widened and traffic increased. There was a decrease in traffic when the{M1 was opened in the{60s.}Residents used to get their water from pumps and wells. Hockliffe was not put on mains water until{World War Two.} Many found jobs outside the village in the{30s when they had to walk, bike or get a lift on a horse and cart. Today most people still work outside the village but travel by car.
